titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the East Hampton property outline 1978.169
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor:
This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.
Revised and expanded description of this collection was made possible thanks to the generosity of The Robert David Lion Gardiner Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-03-21 17:34:47 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: Hand-drawn outline of property lots and their respective owners in the town of East Hampton, Long Island, N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A transcribed list of names in this document is in the collection's digital accession file and available to researchers upon request. The transcription was created by Cecilia Wright, made possible thanks to the generosity of The Robert David Lion Gardiner Foundation.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The original item is in pieces and fragile. Researchers should use the provided photocopies whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: East Hampton property outline, circa 1650-1890, 1978.169; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

This finding aid was revised by Dee Bowers in 2025. Portions of the revised description were written by Cecilia Wright as part of a project to assess and improve access to archival collections in CBH's holdings that relate to Long Island, made possible thanks to the generosity of The Robert David Lion Gardiner Foundation.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Town of East Hampton land patent (1973.160)
Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files (ARC.315) - Series 1: New York City and Long Island: Long Island -- East Hampton
Nathaniel R. Howell Suffolk County, Nassau County, and Queens County deeds collection (1977.243) - East Hampton, Suffolk County materials
Long Island, New York census transcriptions (ARC.194)
Teunis D. Huntting genealogical records of Long Island families (1980.005)
Brooklyn and Long Island deeds collection (1978.006)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hand-drawn outline of property lots and their respective owners in the town of East Hampton, Long Island, N.Y. The drawing represents property on or near East Hampton Street, Calf Pasture Lane (Ocean Avenue), Woods Lane, and Newtown Lane. For each lot representation, the outline contains the names of the individuals who owned the property throughout the period circa 1650 to 1890. The creator of the outline is not known.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
